summary: i know most of my issues with steve’s ending don’t even actually have anything to do with stucky - tho people who are up...
body:
i know most of my issues with steve’s ending don’t even actually have anything to do with stucky - tho people who are up endgame’s ass seem to think that’s the case - but it actually is so ridiculous how people tried to justify it like “oh bucky wouldn’t wanna go with him because he doesn’t have that attachment to the past that steve does” which. putting aside how ridiculous it is that steve would be in love with peggy all this time AND would decide that one relationship is more important than all the relationships he’s built in the twenty-first century….okay even if bucky didn’t care about the life he lost bc of hydra which i have to assume includes his FAMILY, he also doesn’t have any real connections in the present either (that we’ve actually seen onscreen) except for STEVE.

like after peggy dies, both steve and bucky are living in a world where everyone they once knew and loved is dead. except for each other. so in NO WORLD is it okay for steve to go back to that old life, leaving bucky alone in this century??? (yes obvs sam and bucky are going to be Real Friends in their tv show but. again, we haven’t seen them as friends really yet)

i’m so tired of this “steve is allowed to be selfish” shit because sure yes??? but not while hurting people (sam, bucky AND peggy) in the process. it really is such villain-y shit for him to do. i don’t care if bucky knew what he was doing, i don’t care if you think bucky was happy for him. it’s just CRUEL when bucky has already lost everything else: his agency, his life, his family and other friends. i don’t buy that after everything steve would WANT to leave him, and i certainly don’t think it’s acceptable for him to do so

blog.name: frost-iron
blog.title: Frost Iron
blog.description:
Volatile, self-obsessed, doesn't play well with others, and very sexually frustrated.

Welcome to Frost Iron! A blog dedicated to all things Loki/Tony or Tony/Loki if you prefer. If you have any questions or want to submit anything just hit up our ask or submit box. Note: this is a blog for the characters and no RPS(F) will be posted.

Blog owner

summary: Any theories about why Loki was barely in the movie (endgame)? I've lost interest in seeing it now. I might boycott...
question: Any theories about why Loki was barely in the movie (endgame)? I've lost interest in seeing it now. I might boycott Endgame/R*ssos because 1) No Loki 2) No lokitony shipping fodder
answer: Uh, theories… I think just more time/pacing for the movie. They had to cram so much into one film that they couldn’t spend too much time on each story to get the stones. I think they could have utilized Loki so much better, but sadly the script didn’t call for it. :(

reblog.comment: Uh, theories… I think just more time/pacing for the movie. They had to cram so much into one film that they couldn’t spend too much time on each story to get the stones. I think they could have utilized Loki so much better, but sadly the script didn’t call for it. :(

trail.content_raw: Uh, theories… I think just more time/pacing for the movie. They had to cram so much into one film that they couldn’t spend too much time on each story to get the stones. I think they could have utilized Loki so much better, but sadly the script didn’t call for it. :(

summary: Also if they end up using 2012 timeline for the Loki series then fandom's other option is 2014 AU where Thanos disappeared and...
question: Also if they end up using 2012 timeline for the Loki series then fandom's other option is 2014 AU where Thanos disappeared and the Asgardians came to Earth without any further trouble. Frostiron can live at any point in that now canon timeline #clings to AU 2014#
answer: Oh, that would be a wonderful timeline. I’m going to that timeline. The Happy Timeline.

reblog.comment: Oh, that would be a wonderful timeline. I’m going to that timeline. The Happy Timeline.

trail.content_raw: Oh, that would be a wonderful timeline. I’m going to that timeline. The Happy Timeline.

blog.name: theantelopeowl
blog.title: Made Of Stars & Magic
blog.description:
INFP, ace, hufflepuff, thunderbird, a writer, a princess, an avenger, a demigod. A fan of many things, but Chat Noir, Link and Tom Holland's Spider-Man sit above all others. Okay, add Thor and Scarlet Witch too. And Rapunzel and Belle and Tony Stark and LOKI ohgodicantforget loki!!

Anyway...I’m most often found staring up at the stars or drinking tea by the fire, trying to make sense of this crazy world.

blog.name: carissime72
blog.title: Randomness
blog.description: I like Avengers, AoS, Sherlock, photography & nature

body:
Musings on Endgame

@flyingblackhawk did, so why not?

Tony coaching Nebula while playing football, God that was cuteness

Nebula being Tender™️ with Tony while he’s almost dying shook me.

The whole scene of Tony coming off the ship, Steve rushing to meet him and Tony saying, “I lost the kid.”

Moments later, Tony going off, looking like nothing we had ever seen before, I was mesmerized all 3 Times I saw the movie. That, good people, is breadth of talent.

Thor pushing up and calling Stormbreaker, whooshing Carol’s hair.

“Build-a-Bear”

When FIVE appeared on the screen in unison we went “pleasedontbeyears, pleasedontbeyears”

Pepper. I haven’t been much of a Pepper fan, but every scene Paltrow was in, she was just perfection.

Nat talking to Rhodey - “please?” I knew they would find him, but it was a great scene on the toll the new world order had taken on Nat. Pretty sure they filmed scenes of Nat spending her time alone at the compound, training, crying

Tokyo - heartbreak & hope. I was so excited to see Renner & to see Him with ScarJo!

The opening scene on the Barton farm: statistically unlikely. Once again using the family as a plot device to wring emotion out of the viewer. But given all that, if I had made this movie- I would have put it on the end of Infinity War. If I was actually stuck with the family in the story.

Clint getting up & stumbling forward from the building collapse. Classic Hawkeye.

Also Clint readily giving the glove to T’Challa. I couldn’t help but feel Clint was thinking, “ yeah. Take the muther cocker. I don’t wanna be ‘it’”.

Loki - always a pleasure.

Tony & Morgan: so much joy in the those scenes.

Vormir - 1st time. at the edge my seat, holding my breath the Whole time. I love them both, but still, if I HAD to choose I would always want to Clint survive.

2nd time: still heartbreaking

3rd time: these 2 Actors just amaze me.


Dock scene after Natasha, y’know…. pissed me off. The third time I saw the movie I realized they all know her ending & just didn’t even give us a hint.


The final battle:

Thor’s transformation: glorious!

Steve pulling that hammer? The whole damn house light up.

Thor: “No,No. Give me that. You take the little one. “ so.so satisfying.

tags: i just have too many feels ok
summary: i will try to fix you
title: i will try to fix you
body:
Title: I will try to fix you

Pairing: Steve Rogers/Natasha Romanoff

Rating: PG

Genre: Angst…a lot of angst. Also deals with PTSD.

Summary: "Having grown up in the Red Room, Natasha has always been so sure of herself. All her trainings and life in general have roughen her edges and toughen every core of her body—unfortunate circumstances and ugly reality couldn’t hurt her, they’ve never hurt. Natasha has always swallowed them down like jagged pills and dealt with the horrible, bitter aftertaste with not more than a frown on her face. She is strong. She is unfazed. She is alone, works best alone—accustomed to the hollowness in her chest, the empty feeling in the pits of her stomach. She is always sure of this, always, until she became an Avenger. 

Now, she isn’t sure anymore. Not when she wakes with a startling jolt, her breath hitches in shock. Suddenly she is scrambling out of her bed, stumbling onto the floor ungracefully and completely uncharacteristic of her, tears blurring her vision.“

Or in other words; Natasha is hurting, and she doesn’t know how to make the pain stop. Steve is there to comfort her, but he is hurting, too.

Read this fic here on ao3!

Genre: Angst…a lot of angst. Also deals with PTSD.

Summary: "Having grown up in the Red Room, Natasha has always been so sure of herself. All her trainings and life in general have roughen her edges and toughen every core of her body—unfortunate circumstances and ugly reality couldn’t hurt her, they’ve never hurt. Natasha has always swallowed them down like jagged pills and dealt with the horrible, bitter aftertaste with not more than a frown on her face. She is strong. She is unfazed. She is alone, works best alone—accustomed to the hollowness in her chest, the empty feeling in the pits of her stomach. She is always sure of this, always, until she became an Avenger. 

Now, she isn’t sure anymore. Not when she wakes with a startling jolt, her breath hitches in shock. Suddenly she is scrambling out of her bed, stumbling onto the floor ungracefully and completely uncharacteristic of her, tears blurring her vision.“

Or in other words; Natasha is hurting, and she doesn’t know how to make the pain stop. Steve is there to comfort her, but he is hurting, too.

Read this fic here on ao3!
trail.content:

summary: ok i know there’s no need to go off abt this at 8am but one thing that’s now really confusing me about endgame is when peter...
body: ok i know there’s no need to go off abt this at 8am but one thing that’s now really confusing me about endgame is when peter comes back he says “i must’ve passed out” to tony which is meant to be like funny to the audience cause we all know he fucking died but like ….. that does NOT make any sense in the context of his last moments in infinity war. the reason that peter’s death scene in iw was so gripping is that peter is aware he’s slipping away. he knows exactly what’s happening and he’s frightened. he says “i don’t want to go, please” and reaches out, grasping at the nearest person. that is absolutely “i know i’m dying” behavior and so for him to be like “lol what happened” is ….. weird to say the least

summary: I half-expected Thor to become thin and muscular when he grabbed mjolnir and harnessed lightning, because that's what normally...
body: I half-expected Thor to become thin and muscular when he grabbed mjolnir and harnessed lightning, because that’s what normally happens in films. Fatness is played for laughs then quickly abandoned for a typical “hero” physique. But I’m so glad he didn’t. While the treatment of his PTSD may have been cavalier and flippant I’ll never forget how he was able to confront Thanos while keeping his physique, because Thor is Thor is Thor, and his worthiness comes from his heart, and nothing can change that

summary: What Would Really Happen To Earth If Thanos' Snap Was Reversed Adding 3.5 Billion Population In An Instant?
title: What Would Really Happen To Earth If Thanos' Snap Was Reversed Adding 3.5 Billion Population In An Instant?
excerpt: Thanos snapped his fingers and half of the world's population disappeared, disintegrated into dust. When Hulk used the stones five years later, he brought back all that was lost. What will the consequences be of adding 3.5 billion people back into society? Though there might be initial troubles, human beings have managed, to some extent, the increase in world population.
